item.title: Bridge over troubled water
item.description: Calculating the probability of crossing a river, via a series of 13 bridges, where some have been knocked out by a storm. Both a brute-force and an elegant solution.
item.dc:creator: Søren

item.title: Project Euler problem 4 - Largest palindrome product
item.description: Solution to the fourth Project Euler problem. Finding the largest palindromic number, which is a product between two 3-digit numbers.
item.dc:creator: Søren

item.title: Project Euler problem 3 - Largest prime factor
item.description: Solution to the third Project Euler problem. Finding the largest prime factor of an integer.
item.dc:creator: Søren

item.title: Solving Scott’s pentomino problem with DLX
item.description: Solving a famous tiling puzzle using Knuth’s DLX algorithm.
item.dc:creator: Søren

item.title: Project Euler problem 2 - Even Fibonacci numbers
item.description: Solution to the second Project Euler problem. Calculating the sum of even Fibonacci numbers.
item.dc:creator: Søren

item.title: Exact cover and Donald Knuth’s DLX algorithm
item.description: A Python implementation of Donald Knuth’s DLX algorithm for solving exact cover problems.
item.dc:creator: Søren

item.title: Project Euler problem 1 - Multiples of 3 and 5
item.description: Solution to the first Project Euler problem about calculating the sum of integers divisible by 3 and 5.
item.dc:creator: Søren
